result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna Marie Lukasavitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donna Marie Lukasavitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donna Marie Lukasavitz was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation in St. Croix County no later than 6/22/22.
- 13 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Apply bond. Balance payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF195.
- $250 DNA Surcharge.  Apply bond. Balance payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF195.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Test randomly and regularly.
- Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donna Marie Lukasavitz

records.addlTxt:
03:52 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Donna Marie Lukasavitz appeared.  Atty Satorius recites joint agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  NC to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 22CF195.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF195. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF195.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: in Ct 1 in 22CF195

S/W 2 Years Probation 

- Court Costs: $268.00 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- AODA and follow through
- Absolute Sobriety
- Test randomly and regularly
- Pay Supervision fees
- Sign up for St. Croix County probation by not later than 6/22/22 

- 13 days credit against ultimate sentence.

DE verified address and states DE does have a new phone number but doesn't know it.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:37 AM. bph  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

22SW115 executed on 4/5/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by RMW on 4/5/2022. Filed in 22CF194 and 22CF195. olg
Arraignment on April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

- AMENDED

- Defendant to post the remaining $250 on or before 4/28/22

-   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S.P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

04:15 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Donna Marie Lukasavitz appeared from jail.   Court recalls preliminary hearing from earlier this morning.  Atty Satorius states DE would like to waive.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court considers bond modification.  Court will modify bond at this time, DE to post $250 on or before 4/28/22.  Adjourned 4:24 PM. bph  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:44 AM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, DA:  Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius appeared via phone,  DF:  Donna Marie Lukasavitz appeared from jail. Officer appears - set for a PH. Court reviews file and notes Atty Satorius will be taking this case. Atty Satorius states he was just appointed today. Court reschedules PH for later today, April 6th.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
